alert.note: Alert for Cooke; Grayson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 16 at 5:01PM CDT until March 16 at 5:45PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM CDT FOR EASTERN COOKE AND GRAYSON COUNTIES... At 501 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles north of Callisburg to Gainesville to 11 miles northwest of Sanger, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Sherman, Gainesville, Whitesboro, Denison, Van Alstyne, Howe, Pottsboro, Collinsville, Gunter, Lindsay, Callisburg, Knollwood, Dorchester, Randell Lake, Lake Kiowa, Eisenhower State Park, Ray Roberts Park Johnson Branch, Lake Texoma, Preston and Southmayd. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for north central Texas. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. If on or near Lake Texoma, get off the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
